column1: '''Sarn Gebir''' were the '''Rapids''' of the Great River [[Anduin]]. They appeared as the river's course passed between the [[Emyn Muil]]
column2: above the [[Rauros|Falls of Rauros]]. As they were unnavigable rocks and stony eyots
column3: a portage-way was build on the western bank of the river
column5: until the Orcs of Mordor began to multiply.

column1: While the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] navigated the Anduin
column3: but they reached them sooner than he reckoned
column4: on midnight of [[23 February]]. The stream pulled them towards the eastern bank
column5: where they were ambushed by [[Orcs|Orc]] archers from [[Mordor]]. The Fellowship paddled away from the rapids. During the [[24 February|next day]] they portaged a few miles to the foot of the rapids and resumed their paddling on the morning of [[25 February]].<ref>{{FR|River}}</ref><ref>{{App|Great}}</ref>

column2: Sarn Gebir was a name for the highlands which would later be named [[Emyn Muil]].<ref>{{HM|IX}}

column1: '''2001: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]'':'''
:The ambush at the rapids of Sarn Gebir scene was actually intended to be in this film
column2: to the point that an entire on-location set was built
column3: but was not included in the final cut for one simple reason:  before filming could begin on the set
column4: record-breaking torrential rains and 20 foot high floodwaters washed away the entire set.  So complete was the destruction that not even any wreckage of the set was ''ever'' found.  Without the time or funding to construct a new set
column5: the scene had to be cut from the script.
